author: Manish Bhartiya
comment: Amazing app for reading newsfeeds. It's much better than feedly for sure.

author: Zoe P
comment: For a broad range of news, I can't imagine finding better. NO ADS - thank you so much! Some will say the interface isn't pretty or decorative enough for them, but I don't care about that. It's pleasant to look at, uncluttered, simple.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks!

title: Clean, clear, wide-ranging news

author: kiran Johny
comment: Very good app ..But the developer made too much features that normal people find difficult to comprehend ..If he change this apps design to something like feedly or Google news etc people will like more I believe..

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Yeah I faced this problem too. Will consider fixing this, once I restart development on this app.

author: Kenn Neely
comment: I can't get this to work on my android watch

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: The watch part only shows a notification, when you open an article on your phone.

author: Ahsan Sheikh
comment: Nice

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks!

author: salman farisy
comment: Buggy. Very buggy.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks for your review! Could you please explain the bugs you've found by mailing me at mail@jlelse.eu or create tickets on Github via https://github.com/jlelse/NewsCatchr-OpenSource/issues .

title: Love the UI. Ad-free. Free. Open source.

author: Thorby Corvin
comment: Featureless. Reply: connect to Feedly cloud, connect to Pocket. Um... mark as read?

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Connection to Pocket is possible via the Bookmarks page. Connection to feedly is not possible because feedly is working on a new API and doesn't give tokens anymore.

author: AC Zul
comment: Been playing with this app for about 3 hours now. That is, for about 3 hours now I've been trying to get it to work. I tap the news tile, then choose sources, and then... nothing happens at all. I haven't seen any articles in 3 hours of tapping things over and over and over again. There are other things about that I wanted to point out that would make it a better app, but without any actual news showing up what is the point?  2 stars because the design seems nice enough, but there are definitely some design issues, and a news reader should probably have some news. At least, I would think. Maybe I'm wrong. Paperboy is still King of the News Readers. Just get that one.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Could you please write an mail to the provided email address, because I can't find out your issue.

author: Art Thai
comment: Thank you for making the app

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thank you for using and rating it! 😊

title: Great app lovely interface

author: Henry Koong
comment: By using tiles ui that cannot be reordered is somehow a weird choice.. then users have to tap the selected source then only users have access to the articles which I don't think is a good design choice.. I don't really care about source but the articles and by utilizing tiles that cannot be reordered, that just make users further away from the articles.. Also it'd be better if I can toggle the full article icon thing by default and not tapping it every time and also changing the size of the fonts..
title: Weird UI and some improvements can be made

author: Bob Vanderburgh
comment: I'd love a good news aggregator but this one isn't it. Or maybe it is, but you'd never know it even after installing it. There's a list of categories to choose from, then sources, but when you click the headline you get taken to a new page with...that headline. No article. It's 99 cents for 3 months to unlock the pro features but no mention as to what they are. Maybe the articles? There's also a mysterious button that says it's only available to pro users. OK, so what does it do? Skip this one.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: When you choose one of this tiles you are getting to a list of suggested feeds. Choose one of this feeds and you're seeing articles. 😉

title: Irritating app

author: Scott M
comment: Ui element overlapping everything and every which manner

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks for the report! The problem has been fixed with the latest update. Feel free to update your review 😉.

title: Never tested on a tablet evidently

author: Irina Ideas
comment: Fantastic app, very useful and to the point :) great job

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thank you!

author: Adrian Falah Diratama
comment: Help me so much, runs very smooth, and uses my favorite design, material design.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks for the review!

title: Interesting app

author: Shane B.
comment: Probably the best news app I've stumbled across in a while. Well put together ,I still can't believe I hadn't heard a mention of this. It took me scrolling through the store from boredom to discover this here diamond in the rough. Great job and best wishes.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thank you so much! Share a word about this app with your friends to keep me motivated developing this app ;)

title: 👌

author: Bharath P
comment: Update - working well now. Good looking app, and has pocket integration! Win.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback!

author: Eric Karnes
comment: Unfortunately I need something that syncs with desktop and without any sort of service integration I'm stuck using something else.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback!

title: Looks good and works well.

author: Chema Martín
comment: Some ideas to keep moving forward. 1 -some more fonts, I believe there are several open source ones out there, like ubuntu or roboto. 2 - the article layout is amazing, great work! I would enable a gesture, sliding down from the top to show the picture in full if the article has one. 3 - the share buttons on top are a bit too big in my opinion, and a setting to enable them at the bottom would greatly improve one handed use in big phones like my Nexus 6. 4 - reading themes, like light, sepia, night, etc.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks for your great constructive feedback!

title: Good steps forward

author: Rodrigo Ortiz
comment: My added feeds show news from one or two days ago...not sure it applies to all feeds. Tested: Facebook Newsroom, Vox, Quartz, The Week, The Economist.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: The start page doesn't sort the news after date. It's sorting it after population during the last days. You can see a single feed through choosing it in the Navigation Drawer. I hope this helped you!

title: Outdated news

author: Ayan Chakraborty
comment: A well implemented and clean-looking UI that just requires a couple of tweaks. I hope the future updates would include the option to customize text and the ability to add categories to sort the sites.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback!

title: Seems pretty promising.

author: Luka Šalamun
comment: Really nice and simple concept, just a few more ui tweaks.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: I'll try my best! Thanks for your feedback!

title: Great app

author: Ewan S
comment: Tip: be an actual, usable, newsreader, not a collection of links

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: This is fixed in the latest version

title: TIP:scroll down and use an extractor

author: Aman Mahadeshwar
comment: Incredible app. Loved the design.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thank you and enjoy the app!

title: Such a beautiful app

author: Saleel Velankar
comment: Fresh application, quite fast, very clean. Quite barebones at the moment. Ability to remove sites and to import opml would be really nice. Something to watch.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: The possibility to remove, add and edit sites is available now.

title: Promising app

author: ypsilon katze
comment: Opening the plugins from play store instead of from app let's me use them. Looks promising!

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Try the latest version!

title: Asks for plugins even though I have them installed.

author: Arpit Ganesan
comment: Great app but needs some work on the ui

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Thanks for your feedback!

author: Matt German
comment: Looked promising so keep working at it, but not being able to reorganize or even hide irrelevant topic tiles is a bit silly and most of the articles I want to read are nothing more than headlines not being a "Pro" member.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: Because I don't really understand your concerns, please contact me via the provided e-mail to discuss the problems and to fix them. Thanks!

author: Alexandr Garuppa
comment: No settings, no import feeds from file. App is garbage.

reply.author: jlelse
reply.content: You can import feeds from files now!
